intro: Macodes tabiyahanensis, commonly known as the Philippine flame tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bright red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has glossy, elliptical leaves and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
